item.title: Amber Embrace
item.description:
The lantern's amber glow curled around her trembling form as she descended into the silent cellar. Beneath the broken floorboard, a pair of pale fingers reached up, their touch promising both soothing comfort and unspeakable dread.

]]>

item.title: Mirror in the Corridor
item.description:
A crooked shadow loped across the moonlit corridor. The doll’s glassy eyes reflected her widening panic as it whispered her name. Blood pooled at the threshold while the mirror grinned in her place.

]]>

item.title: The Hallway That Breathes
item.description:
The Hallway That Breathes

The corridor inhaled behind me, walls bulging like lungs as the lights flickered to a jaundiced rhythm.

I ran, but each step rewound, replayed, and returned me to the same door now scratched from the inside.

When the knob turned itself, the house exhaled my name in a wet whisper, and the dark leaned closer.

]]>

item.title: The Third Footstep
item.description:
The Third Footstep

The hallway clock stopped at 3:03 as the third footstep echoed, too close to be mine. Wallpaper blistered outward, exhaling a cold whisper that tasted like cellar dust. When I turned, my shadow stayed facing me, grinning without a face.

]]>

item.title: The Film Kept Moving
item.description:
The Film Kept Moving

Hush fell when the projector died, yet the film kept moving on the wall. Our shadows crawled across the room, frames stuttering into faces not our own. Someone behind us whispered my name with my voice—then stepped out of me.

]]>

item.title: The House That Watches
item.description:
The House That Watches

At midnight, the hallway portraits turned their eyes toward me, their pupils glistening like wet coal. The door behind me closed without a sound, and the key melted into my palm. When the whisper finally spoke my name, it came from inside my mouth.

]]>

item.title: The Corridor That Breathes
item.description:
The Corridor That Breathes

The hallway inhaled, exhaled, and the wallpaper bulged like slow lungs. A shadow stepped from my silhouette and smiled with my missing teeth. When the lights flickered back, the house wore me like a warm mask.

]]>

item.title: Backward Clock Lullaby
item.description:
Backward Clock Lullaby

The hallway clock ticked backward as moonlight poured like milk across the peeling wallpaper. A closed nursery door breathed, and a lullaby hummed without a mouth. When I finally turned the knob, my shadow stepped inside and whispered, Welcome home.

]]>

item.title: The Lagging Reflection
item.description:
The Lagging Reflection

The hallway clock exhaled a minute it never owned, and the portraits blinked in unison. My reflection lagged a breath behind, smiling with someone else’s teeth. When the lights died, its hand pressed the glass from the other side.

]]>

item.title: Velvet Hush
item.description:
Moonlight strobed through the broken shutters as the hallway breathed like a sleeping animal. Footsteps followed my echoes, always one behind, until the light clicked and everything went black. In that velvet hush, my phone screen lit with my face, smiling, closer.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps at 3 AM
item.description:
Footsteps at 3 AM

At 3 a.m., the hallway inhaled, and the framed family photos turned to face me. A wet footstep appeared on the floorboards, then another, pacing closer, though the air was dry and my feet were still. When the door handle twisted, I realized the footsteps were inside my ribs.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps in the Long Hall
item.description:
Footsteps in the Long Hall

The hallway stretched impossibly long, each bulb flickering like a heartbeat. Behind me, soft footsteps matched mine until they didn't. I turned to see my own shadow detach and smile, its teeth gleaming where light should never reach.

]]>

item.title: Breath on the Glass
item.description:
Breath on the Glass

The blackout swallowed the street as my phone flickered, recording nothing but darkness.

On the window, a slow exhale bloomed frost, tracing my name from the outside.

When I dared to look, the reflection smiled without me.

]]>

item.title: The Door Exhaled
item.description:
The Door Exhaled

Moonlight spilled across the hallway as the portraits blinked. My phone vibrated with a text from myself: Don't turn around. Behind me, the door exhaled, and something cold took my hand and squeezed.

]]>

item.title: The Mirror's Grin
item.description:
The Mirror's Grin

At 3 a.m., the hallway breathed, exhaling dust that tasted like regret. A mirror on the landing showed my back slowly turning toward me, smiling with teeth I did not own. The lights went out, but the grin stayed, floating closer in the velvet dark.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps After Midnight
item.description:
Footsteps After Midnight

In the hallway, the lights flicker as something drags its breath along the walls. My phone screen reflects my face until it blinks and shows a second, smiling visage just behind, teeth rimmed with shadow. When I turn, the house inhales and the footsteps arrive from every direction.

]]>

item.title: Between Floors
item.description:
The elevator stalled between floors, and the lights pulsed like breathing. In the mirrored walls, my reflection lagged a beat, then smiled wider than mine. When the doors finally opened, the hallway was empty, but footsteps entered behind me.

]]>

item.title: Static Visitor
item.description:
She woke to the TV reflecting her sleeping face, but the power had been out for hours. As she watched, her reflection blinked, then slowly lifted a finger to beckon toward the screen. When it mouthed, let me in, the room smelled like ozone.

]]>

item.title: Row Thirteen
item.description:
The old cinema woke after midnight, its torn curtains breathing like lungs. As I sat in Row Thirteen, a wet whisper slid down my neck and the empty seat beside me pressed warm. When the screen flared white, I saw my own shadow holding my hand.

]]>

item.title: Night Whispers at the Threshold
item.description:
Night Whispers at the Threshold

The front door breathed, swelling on every exhale, as moonlight pooled like mercury on the floorboards. A whisper learned my name, then began pronouncing it backward, peeling the syllables like skin. When the handle turned by itself, the house leaned closer and listened.

]]>

item.title: Whisper in the Cellar
item.description:
Whisper in the Cellar

Footsteps kept descending after mine, though the staircase ended in dirt. In the swaying bulb, the mirror I never owned revealed my back opening like a door, and something stepping out. When the light died, its breath finished my name.

]]>

item.title: Whisper of the Hallway
item.description:
Whisper of the Hallway

The house exhaled, and the wallpaper fluttered like gills.

I followed the wet footprints upstairs until the last step sighed, welcome back.

Behind me, the front door locked, and my shadow turned to face me with someone else's teeth.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps in the Wallpaper
item.description:
Footsteps in the Wallpaper

The hallway breathed as the wallpaper bulged, printing phantom footsteps that marched toward my door.

I held my breath as the knob turned, each click a metronome for the house's rotten heart.

When the door opened, I saw my own shape step in, slick with shadow, smiling with my teeth.

]]>

item.title: The Breath Behind Me
item.description:
The Breath Behind Me

Footsteps followed me long after the hallway ended. My shadow peeled off the wall, turning to face me with my own startled grin, and whispered, Run. When I did, the lights flickered, the doors vanished, and the breath behind my ear kept speaking my name.

]]>

item.title: Laugh Track in the Hall
item.description:
Laugh Track in the Hall

The corridor stretched like taffy as moonlight painted bubblegum shadows. A paper-thin monster tiptoed behind me, smiling too wide, its eyes stickers that peeled and blinked. When I laughed nervously, the laugh track echoed back, and the audience applauded in hungry silence.

]]>

item.title: Shadow Laugh Track
item.description:
The moon hung like a spotlight while shadows shuffled behind me, their edges outlined in silly, inky strokes. A door creaked open with a comical squeak, and an oversized grin floated out, teeth gleaming like cue-card crescents. When it laughed, the walls wobbled into ripples, and my name appeared in bouncing, blood-red letters.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Ink and Giggling Shadows
item.description:
Midnight Ink and Giggling Shadows

Hush-colored fog rolled down the cul-de-sac as streetlamps blinked like cartoon eyes. Behind me, my shadow slipped free, giggling, then stretched into an inky puppet that tugged at my heels. When I turned, its chalk-smile gaped wide, and the whole night flattened to a celluloid frame where I was the only color.

]]>

item.title: Milk-White Moon, Ink-Black Grins
item.description:
Milk-White Moon, Ink-Black Grins

Moonlight painted the cul-de-sac like spilled milk, and every shadow wore a grin. The paper-eyed clown on my mailbox blinked, ink tears sliding as the streetlamps flickered to a drumbeat I couldn't hear. When I waved back, my hands squeaked.

]]>

item.title: Inside the Mirror
item.description:
The child in the window smiled as fog swallowed the street. My reflection blinked back, but her eyes kept shining, fixed on something over my shoulder. When I turned, the room exhaled cold, and her small hand tapped from inside the mirror.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps Beyond the Door
item.description:
Footsteps Beyond the Door

The hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing the last light as the lock clicked behind me. A shadow stepped where I stood, wearing my shape, and smiled with someone else’s teeth. When it reached for me, every bulb blinked, and I felt myself step away.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Echoes
item.description:
Midnight Echoes

The power died as a crimson moon slid above the drowned houses, and something knocked from inside the mirror. In the glass, my reflection lagged, smiling a beat late, raising a hand I had not moved. When the lights surged back, the mirror was slick with breath and a fingertip message: Let me in.

]]>

item.title: The House Applauds
item.description:
The House Applauds

The hallway flooded as wallpaper bubbled, and pale fingers pushed through in silence.

I whispered my name, and the house whispered it back from inside the walls.

When the lights died, the hands applauded.

]]>

item.title: Whispers in the Projection Booth
item.description:
Whispers in the Projection Booth

Film reels spun backward as the empty theater breathed, each seat folding down for an unseen guest. In the flicker, my shadow stood up without me and waved like it knew a better ending. Then the screen whispered my name, and the doors locked themselves.

]]>

item.title: The Last Seat Breathing
item.description:
The Last Seat Breathing

During the final reel, the empty theater began to whisper, soft as moth wings. I felt the seat beside me tense, then warm, as if something unseen inhaled. When the credits rolled, the screen showed my back rising to leave, and the whispers cheered.

]]>

item.title: The Last Doorway
item.description:
The Last Doorway

The hallway exhaled cold, and the wallpaper peeled like shedding skin. My shadow stepped ahead of me, turned back, and smiled with a mouth it did not own. When the lights flickered off, I heard it whisper, not yet, and felt my hand move without me.

]]>

item.title: When the Hallway Breathed
item.description:
When the Hallway Breathed

At 3:03 a.m., the hallway lengthened like a throat, swallowing the light. Every portrait turned its eyes, and their frames breathed as dust flurried like static. When my phone flashlight died, something whispered my name behind my teeth—and I felt a cold hand reach from inside.

]]>

item.title: Ashen Lullaby
item.description:
Ashen Lullaby

At midnight, the hospital intercom crackled with a child's lullaby that no ward admitted.

Lights flickered, revealing only footprints of ash leading toward my bed.

When the singing stopped, the ash rose, shaped my name with tiny hands, and whispered, hush.

]]>

item.title: Between Floors
item.description:
Between Floors

The elevator stalled between floors, and the mirror kept reflecting one extra person. As emergency lights flickered red, the unseen passenger pressed close, fogging glass from inside the reflection. When the doors finally opened, my body stepped out behind me, smiling with someone else's teeth.

]]>

item.title: The Last Reflection
item.description:
The Last Reflection

I wiped the mist from the bathroom mirror, and the face staring back blinked a beat too late. Lights flickered, stretching the room into a corridor of shadows where something moved between frames. When the power died, my reflection smiled.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps After Midnight
item.description:
Footsteps After Midnight

The hallway breathed, exhaling cold, as footsteps multiplied behind me.

I turned to meet myself, eyes black as doorways, whispering, you shouldn't have looked back.

The house smiled, floorboards bending like teeth, and the lights blinked once, then never again.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps on the Ceiling
item.description:
Footsteps on the Ceiling

The hallway clock ticked backward as the wallpaper breathed like a sleeping lung. In the mirror, my reflection whispered my name, but its lips kept moving after the sound stopped. When the lights finally returned, they illuminated footsteps on the ceiling, fresh and wet.

]]>

item.title: Handshake in the Dark
item.description:
Handshake in the Dark

The hallway stretched longer with every blink, lights humming like trapped hornets. A shadow wore my shape at the far end, grinning where my face would not. When the power died, I felt its cold hand find mine in the dark.

]]>

item.title: The Lagging Mirror
item.description:
The Lagging Mirror

At midnight, the hallway stretched longer with every step, swallowing the house into a hush.

In the mirror, my reflection lagged, lips forming words I hadn't yet thought.

When it finally caught up, its eyes stayed behind, watching me leave.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Reservoir
item.description:
Midnight in the Reservoir

Mist braided the black water as the town's missing names whispered from the surface.

When I leaned closer, my reflection blinked and smiled with someone else's teeth.

The ripples widened into a doorway, and the moonlight cut like a projector beam as my shadow stepped in without me.

]]>

item.title: Between Floors
item.description:
Between Floors

The elevator stopped between floors, and the lights simmered to a blood-tinged glow. In the mirrored walls, my reflection kept breathing after I froze, fog blossoming where my lips never moved. When the doors slid open to darkness, someone else's hand held mine.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps Behind the Wallpaper
item.description:
Footsteps Behind the Wallpaper

Halls breathed as wallpaper blistered, and a shadow pressed its face from inside. I traced the bulge, and something traced me back, fingernails whispering like moths. When the lights died, the wall smiled wide, and my name peeled out in fresh wet paint.

]]>

item.title: Lullaby of the Hallway
item.description:
Lullaby of the Hallway

The humming in the walls swelled like a tide as the lights flickered to ash. I followed the sound, stepping over shadowy footprints that deepened with each beat. When it stopped, the house exhaled my name in a cold, borrowed voice.

]]>

item.title: Smiling in My Absence
item.description:
The hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing each footstep in velvet shadow. Behind me, my shadow lagged, turning its head before I did. When the lights blinked, it smiled in my absence, and something warm breathed at the nape of my neck.

]]>

item.title: The Corridor That Breathed
item.description:
The Corridor That Breathed

Halls exhaled dust as the lights blinked, and the whisper shaped my name. I followed it past doors that bled rust until my own portrait stepped from the wall, smiling. When I turned to run, the corridor inhaled, and my footprints slid backward.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps in the Walls
item.description:
Footsteps in the Walls

The hallway stretched like a throat, lit by sputtering bulbs that hummed like insects. I heard barefoot steps behind the wallpaper, keeping pace, pausing whenever I turned. When the lights died, the paper swelled and breathed, and my name unfurled in a whisper.

]]>

item.title: The Breath in the Hallway
item.description:
The Breath in the Hallway

The last flashlight flickered as the hallway stretched impossibly long, swallowing its own echo.

In each stuttering glow, my shadow turned to stare back, wearing my face and someone else's smile.

When the light died, the hallway breathed, and something wet whispered, "Welcome home", from everywhere at once.

]]>

item.title: Whispers Behind the Door
item.description:
Whispers Behind the Door

Hinges croaked as the door drifted open, revealing a hallway that shouldn't exist. Wallpaper breathed, exhaling dust like ash, and a child's lullaby hummed from the walls. When I answered, the house answered back.

]]>

item.title: Velvet Throat
item.description:
Velvet Throat

The hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing our footsteps into velvet dark. Behind us, a door breathed, then exhaled a child's laugh that wasn't ours. When the light finally flickered on, we saw our backs walking toward us.

]]>

item.title: Flicker in the Hallway
item.description:
Flicker in the Hallway

The hallway flickered like film as the lights stuttered, revealing wet footprints appearing toward me. Each step synced with my breathing, until the shadow at the end smiled and raised a hand that wasn't mine. I blinked, and my screen showed my back from behind, while the prints smeared into welcome.

]]>

item.title: Whisper in the Projection Room
item.description:
Whisper in the Projection Room

Hushed reels spun though the theater was long condemned. On the blank screen, my silhouette raised a hand that I had not moved, waving with patient, deliberate grace. When the projector clicked off, the waving continued in the dark.

]]>

item.title: Silent Stairwell
item.description:
Silent Stairwell

The elevator dings on a floor no one pressed.

Down the lightless stairwell, each step echoes back a half-beat late, as if something follows a breath behind.

When I turn, the echoes stop, and in the stillness, the darkness inhales.

]]>

item.title: Metronome in the Tunnel
item.description:
Metronome in the Tunnel

Footsteps echoed behind me down the train tunnel, matching my breath like a metronome. I turned and saw my own shadow step forward, grinning with teeth it shouldn't have. The lights flickered, and when they steadied, I was the one left on the wall.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Static
item.description:
Midnight Static

The television flickered to life on its own, casting an oily light that crawled across the walls. From the snow of static, my reflection stepped forward and smiled with someone else's teeth. When I reached for the remote, its hand reached first.

]]>

item.title: Whispers in Plaster
item.description:
Whispers in Plaster

The hallway exhaled dust as the lights stuttered, and my shadow lagged half a step behind. A child's giggle slipped from the cracked wall, then moved inside it. When my name was whispered, the bulbs went black, and something kept breathing.

]]>

item.title: Between Floors
item.description:
Between Floors

The elevator shuddered to a halt between floors, and the lights dimmed to a feverish red.

In the mirrored walls, a fourth reflection blinked where only three of us stood, smiling with borrowed teeth.

When the doors finally opened, the hallway beyond was our apartment, but older, watered by silence, and already waiting.

]]>

item.title: When the Mirror Grinned
item.description:
When the Mirror Grinned

At midnight, the mirror grinned before I did. Behind my reflection, a hallway stretched where my bedroom wall should be. When the other me stepped forward, the glass felt warm, and my smile finally wasn't mine.

]]>

item.title: Whispers in the Projection Room
item.description:
Whispers in the Projection Room

The film kept running after the theater emptied, frames fluttering like moths against the beam.

I heard my own footsteps echo onscreen, seconds before they happened, and the curtains breathed.

When the reel burned white, a darker silhouette stepped out, and I realized I was no longer casting a shadow.

]]>

item.title: The Backward Hour
item.description:
At 3:03, the hallway clock began to tick backwards. My reflection stepped out of the mirror, wet footprints blooming across the tiles as the house held its breath. When I whispered my name, a dozen voices answered, and only one was mine.

]]>

item.title: Blackout Reflection
item.description:
Blackout Reflection

In the blackout, the hospital corridors breathed like sleeping beasts. An elevator chimed though every floor was dead, and a child's laugh skittered along the tiles. When the lights returned, my reflection stayed behind, still whispering, don't turn around.

]]>

item.title: Moonlit Bone Staircase
item.description:
At midnight, the ocean receded and exposed a gleaming staircase of bone. I followed down as moonlight flickered like projector reels on the wet ribs. When the tide returned, the last step sighed my name from the dark.

]]>

item.title: Echoes in the Projection
item.description:
Echoes in the Projection

The hallway stretched too long, rippling like film, as the lights flickered to a heartbeat.

Behind me, my shadow whispered my name, but its mouth was facing me.

When I turned, the screen of night closed, and the credits spelled my last breath.

]]>

item.title: Whisper at the Threshold
item.description:
Whisper at the Threshold

Wind pressed the hallway wallpaper flat as the house inhaled. My phone flashlight caught a doorway where there wasn’t one, and the figure inside turned, wearing my face and a smile I never learned. When it whispered my name, the lights obeyed, and blinked.

]]>

item.title: Night Window
item.description:
Night Window

The blackout arrived like a curtain, yet the mirror kept a pale glow. In its glass, my room replayed without me breathing. When the reflection turned its head and smiled, the house exhaled someone else’s name.

]]>

item.title: The Projector's Call
item.description:
The Projector's Call

At midnight, the old theater projected a film no one remembered shooting. Onscreen, my silhouette turned, raised a hand, and beckoned with an impossible grin. The auditorium doors locked themselves as the projector light bled down the aisles toward me.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps in the Film Grain
item.description:
Footsteps in the Film Grain

The hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing every step I took. Behind me, the portraits blinked, their varnished eyes adjusting to the dark as the house inhaled. When the lights flickered back, my shadow stayed on the wall, waving goodbye.

]]>

item.title: Night Passenger
item.description:
Night Passenger

The bus windows reflected empty streets until a face appeared beside mine, breathing frost on the glass. I turned to an aisle of shadows and an abandoned coat, still warm. The driver counted passengers, stopped at two, and whispered, Who's the third?

]]>

item.title: Between Floors
item.description:
The elevator stopped between floors, and the lights slid to a bruised dusk.

In the mirrored walls, our reflections kept breathing after we did, fogging glass with slow, borrowed lungs.

When the doors finally parted, the hallway waited, mouth open, numbering us wrong.

]]>

item.title: The Footsteps Behind Glass
item.description:
The Footsteps Behind Glass

The theater screen flickered as my reflection stayed on it after I stood.

Rows of empty seats breathed like bellows, and a crimson EXIT sign hummed like a heartbeat.

When the reflection turned and smiled, the sound of clapping came from behind the screen.

]]>

item.title: Matinee of Absence
item.description:
Matinee of Absence

The projector coughed awake in the abandoned cinema, casting frames of strangers who grinned too wide. In the reflected glow, an empty seat creaked, then another, as dust swirled like breath. When I looked back at the screen, my own closing credits were rolling, and something stood blocking the exit.

]]>

item.title: Three Knocks After Midnight
item.description:
Three Knocks After Midnight

Hinges sighed as the nursery door opened itself. In the rocking chair, something invisible swayed, humming my mother’s lullaby in a voice full of teeth. When I switched on the light, the chair stopped, and the cradle kept rocking.

]]>

item.title: Curtain Call for a Shadow
item.description:
Night drifted into the abandoned theater, and the velvet seats inhaled dust.

Onstage, my shadow bowed, then stood without me, smiling with someone else's teeth.

The applause began from the dark, a slow thud, and the curtains crept shut behind me.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Corridor
item.description:
Midnight Corridor

The hallway stretched longer with every step, wallpaper sighing like wet lungs.

Behind me, footsteps synchronized with my breath, pausing whenever I dared to listen.

When the lights flickered, the portraits turned their eyes, and my shadow smiled first.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps in the Wallpaper
item.description:
Footsteps in the Wallpaper

The hallway clock stopped mid-tick, and the house leaned in to listen.

Behind the peeling wallpaper, something whispered my name, tracing cold letters along the studs.

I tore a strip free and found my own open eye staring back, blinking in perfect time.

]]>

item.title: Applause in the Dark
item.description:
Moonlight seeped through the abandoned theater, silvering rows of torn velvet. Onstage, my shadow bowed to an audience of empty seats, then kept bowing after I froze. From the curtains, something clapped—wet, deliberate—until the lights died.

]]>

item.title: The Last Light in the Corridor
item.description:
The Last Light in the Corridor

The hallway flickered like a dying reel as something pale stepped between frames.

I whispered my name, and the echo came back wearing breath that wasn’t mine.

When the bulb finally hummed steady, every door was open—except my own.

]]>

item.title: Playground Whispers
item.description:
Wind shoved the rusted swings as the playground whispered my name. In the sandbox, tiny handprints deepened, filling with shadow until they crawled over my shoes. When I looked up, every seat was occupied by children of dust, smiling with borrowed teeth.

]]>

item.title: The House That Breathes
item.description:
The House That Breathes

At midnight, the hallway exhaled a damp, cold breath that smelled like the river under the house. Wallpaper blistered as footsteps paced on the ceiling, tracing my bed like a hunting orbit. When I whispered hello, something whispered back in my own voice, closer, and the doorknob turned.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Corridor
item.description:
Midnight Corridor

At midnight, the hallway stretched longer than the old house could contain.

Behind me, footsteps matched mine, then stopped when I did.

I turned, and the family portraits blinked in unison, their smiles widening as the lights dimmed.

]]>

item.title: Whispers in the Hall
item.description:
Whispers in the Hall

The elevator doors opened to an empty floor, yet wet footprints walked past me and faded into the dark.

When I called out, a hundred whispers answered in my voice, weaving around the flickering lights.

I looked down to see my own prints stop at the edge, and the shadow kept walking without me.

]]>

item.title: Whisper Under the Door
item.description:
Whisper Under the Door

The hallway breathed in time with the flickering bulbs, and the peeling wallpaper whispered my name. A shadow slipped beneath the door, stretching like spilled ink, and paused to listen. When I exhaled, it exhaled back, from inside my lungs.

]]>

item.title: The Third Footstep
item.description:
In the blackout hallway, the portraits turned their eyes as my candle guttered. Footsteps matched mine until a third fell out of sync, pacing just behind the door I had locked. When it opened, the candle’s flame inhaled—and recognized me.

]]>

item.title: Breathing Walls
item.description:
Breathing Walls

The hallway clock choked on midnight as the wallpaper began to breathe. From the seams, a thin pale hand slid out, pointing at me with a shaking nail. I turned off the light to hide, and in the blooming dark the finger pressed my lips and another breath exhaled from inside the walls.

]]>

item.title: Whisper in the Projector Light
item.description:
Whisper in the Projector Light

Film dust floated like snow as the theater flickered back to life. In the silent audience, empty seats exhaled, and my shadow stood up without me. When it turned around, its mouth was mine, wide and shining with other people's voices.

]]>

item.title: The Aisle Behind Me
item.description:
The Aisle Behind Me

Hush fell as the projector flickered, and the empty theater breathed cold. Onscreen, my childhood home appeared, windows lit, a figure waving from my old bedroom. When the frame panned behind me, the waving shadow stepped into the aisle.

]]>

item.title: Backwards Ticking
item.description:
Backwards Ticking

The hallway clock ticked backward as the house exhaled frost. In the mirror, my reflection blinked out, leaving only the damp imprint of my breath. Footsteps approached from the empty second skin beside me, and a cold hand slid into mine.

]]>

item.title: Audience of One
item.description:
Audience of One

The theater's velvet seats exhaled dust as I slipped into the last row.

Onstage, a curtain fluttered though the air was still, and the mirror's surface rippled.

When I realized the reflection was waving before I moved, every seat sighed back.

]]>

item.title: Three Knocks at Platform Nine
item.description:
Three Knocks at Platform Nine

The power died as the last train passed, and the station breathed like a sleeping animal. In the glass, my reflection blinked without me, its eyes wet with someone else’s night. When the lights surged back, it stood behind me, smiling with my unbroken teeth.

]]>

item.title: Lagging Reflection
item.description:
The hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing my footsteps. In the mirror, my reflection lagged, smiling a frame too late. When the house exhaled, the lights died, and something took my hand with my mother’s voice.

]]>

item.title: The Projector's Whisper
item.description:
The projector flickered to life, bleeding light across peeling wallpaper. In the grainy beam, my shadow turned its head and smiled at someone behind me. When I dared to glance back, the seats were empty—yet warm breath brushed my ear.

]]>

item.title: The Breathing Door
item.description:
The Breathing Door

The elevator opened to a hallway that shouldn't exist, lined with doors that inhaled and sighed.

I followed my name, whispered from behind every knob, until the lights shivered out.

When they flickered back, only one door remained—already ajar, still breathing, and wearing my voice.

]]>

item.title: Breath Behind Me
item.description:
Breath Behind Me

The hallway stretched like a vein under flickering exit signs. A wet footprint appeared ahead of me, then another, weaving toward the locked door as the lights pulsed red like a heartbeat. When the power died, a hand pressed my mouth from behind and kept breathing.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps After Midnight
item.description:
Footsteps After Midnight

The hallway stretched like a throat, breathing cold and slow. I heard my own footsteps ahead of me, echoing from an empty turn, then stopping to listen. When the lights flickered, the shadow moved closer, whispering my name.

]]>

item.title: The Reel That Wouldn't End
item.description:
The Reel That Wouldn't End

Snow hissed against the broken windows as the film projector flickered. On the wall, my childhood shadow waved back, seconds out of sync, its smile widening in each frame. When the reel ended, the shadow kept moving, whispering, stay.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps Behind the Wallpaper
item.description:
Footsteps Behind the Wallpaper

The hallway lengthened with each step, walls breathing like tired lungs.

When the light flickered, I saw my shadow split, and the second one turned to face me.

I held my breath as its mouth opened, whispering my name in my voice.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Echoes
item.description:
Midnight Echoes

The hallway clock stopped at 3:13, and the walls inhaled like lungs. In the mirror, my reflection blinked late, then smiled with someone else’s teeth. Footsteps circled the bed, soft as moths, until the light burned out and the whisper said, Don't turn around.

]]>

item.title: At 3:03, the House Inhaled
item.description:
At 3:03, the House Inhaled

At 3:03, the house inhaled, and every door quietly clicked shut. In the hallway mirror, my reflection lagged a heartbeat, then smiled with someone else's teeth. When the lights returned, footprints bloomed wetly up the ceiling, and my name exhaled from the attic in a child's perfect whisper.

]]>

item.title: Breath on the Glass
item.description:
Breath on the Glass

At dusk, my reflection stepped out of the window glass and whispered my name. It breathed frost on my cheek while the house exhaled darkness, walls pulsing like a sleeping lung. Don't blink, it said, and I vanished.

]]>

item.title: The Smile Behind the Glass
item.description:
The Smile Behind the Glass

Hush poured through the farmhouse as the lights died. In the mirror, my reflection blinked after I did, smiling with someone else's teeth. When it stepped forward, leaving the glass slick with breath, I heard my name spoken from behind my eyes.

]]>

item.title: The Mirror That Breathed
item.description:
The Mirror That Breathed

Hush flooded the house as the power died. Down the hallway, a mirror filmed over like breath. Behind my reflection, something raised a hand—and the lights came back on.

]]>

item.title: The Tunnel That Breathed
item.description:
The Tunnel That Breathed

Footsteps followed me down the tunnel, perfectly matching my breath. My phone’s light found wet walls and a shadow that stood where I should be, grinning without a face. When I turned to run, the tunnel exhaled my name.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps Behind the Fog
item.description:
Footsteps Behind the Fog

The streetlamps sputtered as fog crawled in, muffling the world to a wet whisper. I saw my silhouette step ahead without me and turn back, smiling. When its grin widened, my own breath moved beside my ear and said, Stay.

]]>

item.title: Moonlight in the Hallway
item.description:
Moonlight in the Hallway

Moonlight slid across the hallway as the last portrait blinked. I held my breath, counting twelve footsteps that stopped exactly where my shadow ended. When the phone flashed a selfie, the background smiled with my face—older, hungrier, already stepping closer.

]]>

item.title: Wrong Floor
item.description:
Wrong Floor

At 3:17, the elevator opened on a floor that didn't exist yesterday. The corridor breathed, peeling wallpaper fluttering as if it remembered my name, and every door sighed my syllables. When the lights died, something kept the glow—my shadow, grinning, stepped closer.

]]>

item.title: When the Walls Leaned In
item.description:
The house inhaled as I crossed the threshold, and the wallpaper lifted like damp skin.

From the upstairs darkness, something sighed my name in my mother’s voice.

When I turned, the front door had moved closer, smiling, and all the walls leaned in.

]]>

item.title: Whisperglass
item.description:
Whisperglass

Something knocks from inside the mirror; the glass fogs, spelling my name. Behind me, the corridor blooms with shadow as the bulbs hiss out one by one. When I turn back, my reflection smiles and lifts a finger to her lips.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Attic
item.description:
Midnight in the Attic

At 3 a.m., the attic door creaked open by itself, exhaling dust like breath. I followed the muffled humming, and the family portraits turned their faces, one by one. Then the humming spoke my name in my mother's voice, and the trapdoor slammed, sealing the light to a thin, smiling blade.

]]>

item.title: The Mirror Didn't Blink
item.description:
Moonlight painted the hallway silver as the grandfather clock ticked backward. A door I’d never owned creaked open, exhaling a chill that carried my name in a child’s whisper. When I flicked the switch, the mirror kept our faces lit, but mine didn’t move.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Hollow House
item.description:
Midnight in the Hollow House

The hallway exhaled a chill as the portraits turned their eyes, and my breath stitched white threads in the dark.

Behind the walls, something knocked three times, then laughed in a child's voice.

I lifted the candle—its flame bent toward me, whispering, run.

]]>

item.title: Late in the Mirror
item.description:
At midnight, the hallway sighed and the wallpaper seemed to breathe. Footsteps approached from the wrong end of the mirror, each one smearing the glass. When my reflection smiled without me, its teeth kept moving and whispered, you're late.

]]>

item.title: The Hallway's Smile
item.description:
The hallway kept lengthening as I ran, each door whispering my name. Behind me, footsteps matched mine, but every shadow stayed still except the one under my skin. When I turned, my face was already waiting, smiling.

]]>

item.title: Flicker in the Attic
item.description:
The projector flickered, and the family's home movie began to bleed at the edges.

Footsteps echoed behind me in time with the film's stuttering frames, though I was alone in the attic.

When the reel stopped, the footsteps didn't.

]]>

item.title: Echoes in the Corridor
item.description:
Footsteps echoed behind me, perfectly matching mine, until the corridor lights flickered like dying stars. I turned, and the hallway stretched longer, doors breathing open. In every doorway, my face smiled, eyes patiently adjusting.

]]>

item.title: The Hallway Inhales
item.description:
The Hallway Inhales

The hallway inhaled, exhaled, and my breath fogged in the heatless dark. Behind me, footsteps matched mine, half a beat late, like a stranger rehearsing me. I turned, and the wall opened an eye—my own—blinking from fresh plaster.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Stairwell
item.description:
Midnight in the Stairwell

The elevator sighed open, and the corridor exhaled a cold, hospital-blue hush.

Footsteps followed mine out of sync, an echo that lingered after I stopped.

I turned, and the stairwell yawned—each step holding my face, but none of them blinking.

]]>

item.title: The House Across the Ravine
item.description:
Through the fogged window, the house across the ravine blinked its lights like wet eyes. My phone vibrated: a text from upstairs, though I lived alone—'Stop watching me'. When the mirror breathed, it wasn’t my reflection that fogged back.

]]>

item.title: Night Window
item.description:
Night Window

The power died; still, the television flickered with our living room, five seconds behind.

When I waved, the me on-screen didn't.

Then the door in the broadcast opened, and something stepped out, ahead of the delay.

]]>

item.title: Whisper Behind the Door
item.description:
Whisper Behind the Door

At midnight, the hallway bulb flickered, and the wallpaper seemed to breathe.

From the nursery, a music box wound itself, playing a lullaby I never learned.

When I opened the door, my shadow stepped out first and whispered, 'Welcome home,' in a voice that was mine.

]]>

item.title: Echoes in Red
item.description:
Echoes in Red

Footsteps echoed down the hospital corridor as the emergency lights hiccuped, painting the walls in stuttering red. In a window’s reflection, my body stood still while my shadow turned to face me. It smiled, and the alarms finally learned my name.

]]>

item.title: Night Window Whisper
item.description:
Night Window Whisper

The streetlight flickered as a shape gathered in the glass, every shimmer sharpening its grin.

I realized the reflection moved when I didn't, mouthing my name in backward breaths.

When the light died, the window stayed bright, and something warm pressed its forehead to mine from the other side.

]]>

item.title: The House That Answered
item.description:
The House That Answered

Moonlight painted the hallway silver as the portraits blinked. My breath bloomed in the cold, and an unseen nail scraped the wall, inching closer. When I whispered hello, the house whispered back my voice, older, hungrier, echoing forever.

]]>

item.title: Thunder Arrives Late
item.description:
Thunder Arrives Late

At 3:13 a.m., the hallway unspooled like film, each frame revealing another door that hadn't existed. From the final doorway, my mother stepped out, lips moving but the sound arrived late, like thunder. When I reached for her, my hand closed on crawlspace air.

]]>

item.title: The Exit That Smiled
item.description:
The Exit That Smiled

She ran as the corridor stretched longer, each door yawning wider than it should. Behind her, footsteps synchronized with her pulse until a second pulse throbbed from the walls. The exit sign blinked, revealing her shadow waving back, and smiling.

]]>

item.title: Whispers in the Hallway
item.description:
Whispers in the Hallway

The lights stuttered, stretching my shadow until it wore my face. Down the empty corridor, a door creaked open and exhaled my name in a wet, too-familiar whisper. When I turned, my footsteps kept walking without me.

]]>

item.title: Whispers Under the Door
item.description:
Whispers Under the Door

The hallway stretched too long, swallowing my footsteps as the lights stuttered. From the nursery, a lullaby threaded backward through the air, each note scratching like a nail across glass. When the door finally opened, the crib was empty, but something small and breathing pressed its face to mine.

]]>

item.title: The Grin That Stayed
item.description:
At dusk, the power dies, and the hallway inhales like a throat. A peeled grin blooms in the mirror behind me, not mine, not human. When the lights return, the grin stays, and my reflection is gone.

]]>

item.title: Echoes in the Corridor
item.description:
Echoes in the Corridor

The hallway stretched too long, each bulb stuttering like a dying heartbeat. Behind me, footsteps matched mine, pausing whenever I held my breath.

When I turned, the shadows wore my face and kept walking toward me.

]]>

item.title: The Breath Behind the Door
item.description:
The Breath Behind the Door

At 3 a.m., the corridor breathed like a sleeping animal. My shadow stepped ahead without me, turning to listen. When the door opened, the room was empty except for the echo whispering my name.

]]>

item.title: Her Smile in the Dark Elevator
item.description:
The power died as the elevator sank between floors, leaving me in a breathless hush.

In the mirror-polished doors, a second me smiled and pressed a finger to lips, not mine.

When the lights returned, the doors opened on a hallway that wasn't our building—and she stepped out first.

]]>

item.title: Flicker in the Hallway
item.description:
Flicker in the Hallway

The power dies, yet the hallway light keeps pulsing like a heartbeat, revealing wallpaper that crawls.

With every blink, the portrait at the far end turns its head a degree, lips parting to inhale.

On the last flash, I see my own back in the frame, and the corridor swallows the sound of my name.

]]>

item.title: Half a Beat Late
item.description:
At midnight, the hallway lengthened like a breath held too long. The portraits blinked in unison, their eyes tracking the one light that wouldn't die. Behind me, footsteps matched mine, half a beat late, as if waiting to take the next.

]]>

item.title: Flicker in the Boards
item.description:
Wind rattled the boarded windows as the film projector flickered, repainting the room in jittering ghosts. I watched my sleeping twin rise onscreen and turn to stare at me. In the dark, something breathed, perfectly syncing with my name.

]]>

item.title: Mirror Breath
item.description:
Mirror Breath

At midnight, the hallway mirror exhaled frost where my face should have been. From the fog, three pale fingerprints slid across the inside of the glass. When I reached to wipe them away, a colder hand pressed back, and the corridor behind me kept moving, though I did not.

]]>

item.title: Whisper Behind the Door
item.description:
Whisper Behind the Door

At midnight, the hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing the house in hush. The door breathed once, and a smear of shadow peeled forward, grinning where no face should be. When I whispered hello, something answered from inside my mouth.

]]>

item.title: The Mirror Answers
item.description:
At midnight, the hallway exhaled dust as portraits turned their eyes toward me. Footsteps echoed from the ceiling, syncing with my breath until my own shadow began to lag behind. When I whispered hello, something standing inside the mirror whispered my name back, closer.

]]>

item.title: Night Shift Echoes
item.description:
Night Shift Echoes

Footsteps echoed down the hospital corridor, but no one was there. A pale hand tapped my shoulder, and the lights dimmed to midnight. I turned to see myself grinning, mouth full of teeth that weren't mine.

]]>

item.title: Midnight Window
item.description:
Midnight Window

The power died, yet the hallway glowed like a moonlit set, long shadows crawling past the nursery door.

I watched my reflection in the window lift a finger to its lips, seconds before I did.

Behind me, something breathed in sync, and the glass fog spelled my name backward.

]]>

item.title: Footsteps After Midnight
item.description:
Footsteps After Midnight

I heard my own steps echo down the corridor until a second set began, softer and perfectly timed. The lights hummed, then one by one died, revealing a door I never noticed, breathing. When it opened, something whispered my name in my voice.

]]>

item.title: Backward Floor
item.description:
Backward Floor

The elevator doors reopened to the same deserted hallway, the floor numbers bleeding backward.

My phone flickered a new reflection: me, but watching from behind, smiling with too many teeth.

When the lights died, something kept breathing in my ear.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Projection Booth
item.description:
Midnight in the Projection Booth

The film kept playing after I pulled the plug, frames stuttering like a dying heart.

On the screen, my empty seat turned its head to find me.

From the darkness behind the lens, something breathed my name.

]]>

item.title: Smile Behind Glass
item.description:
Smile Behind Glass

Haze-gray dawn leaked through the cracked aquarium, illuminating the drowned dolls lined like witnesses. From inside the glass, knuckles tapped out my name, each rap blooming fog on the wrong side. When I turned, my reflection smiled first—and kept smiling after I ran.

]]>

item.title: Borrowed Shadow
item.description:
Moonlight slicked the hallway as the portraits turned their eyes to me. From the attic, a lullaby played backward, each note peeling paint from the walls. When I finally looked down, the shadow holding my hand wasn't mine.

]]>

item.title: Midnight in the Hall of Eyes
item.description:
Midnight in the Hall of Eyes

At midnight, the hallway stretched longer than the house could hold. Each family portrait turned its eyes toward me, their varnished smiles rippling like oil. When the light switch clicked, someone else’s breath misted beside mine, and the floorboards leaned to listen.

]]>

item.title: Borrowed Teeth
item.description:
Borrowed Teeth

The hallway breathed, exhaling dust that glittered like drowned stars. Behind me, my shadow detached and turned, smiling with teeth it had borrowed. When the lights flickered back, it stood closer than skin, mouthing my name.

]]>

item.title: The Reflection That Stayed
item.description:
The hallway breathed as the wallpaper bubbled, exhaling a sour, antique heat. Footprints appeared wetly across the parquet toward me, each step pausing as if listening. When the lights flickered, my reflection stayed in the black window, smiling with a mouth I didn't own.

]]>

item.title: Borrowed Shadow
item.description:
Borrowed Shadow

Night fell like a velvet shutter as the lighthouse winked out. In the sudden black, footsteps circled me, pacing in a widening ring, though the rocks were empty. When the beam flared, my shadow was gone—but something else wore it.

]]>

item.title: Whispers at the Threshold
item.description:
At midnight, the hallway stretched like a throat, swallowing each step. A door I never owned opened, spilling a thin ribbon of cold and a child's whisper: come in. When the light behind me flickered out, the house exhaled, and something exhaled back.

]]>

item.title: Echoes in the Dark
item.description:
Echoes in the Dark

The hallway breathed as the lights flickered, stretching shadows into long, watching ribs. Behind me, footsteps kept perfect time with mine, though I had stopped. When the final bulb died, something whispered my name from inside my open mouth.

]]>
